intro: Hippocrepis confusa var. austro-oranensis, commonly known as the Southern Oran orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive hooded structure that resembles an orchid, hence its common name. This variety is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
